original: NOW, THEREFORE , in consideration of the mutual agreements, provisions and covenants contained in this Agreement, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties, intending to be legally bound, hereby agree as follows:
modified:
HEREBY, THUS AGREED, with the understanding that the concessions, terms, and commitments enclosed within this Agreement serve as the basis for our mutual obligations, and in recognition of additional satisfactory reasons, the parties, willing to assume legal responsibility, hereby consent as follows:

This revised clause shifts the tone slightly by using "willing to assume legal responsibility" instead of "intending to be legally bound," which may subtly imply a more proactive approach towards fulfilling obligations. The word "Hereby" has been kept consistent in both versions for continuity and legalese style.

original: 1.3 Trademark Notices.  All print and electronic displays of the Licensed Mark by Licensee shall include at Licensor’s option, a notice to the effect that the Licensed Mark are owned by Licensor and used by Licensee under license from Licensor.
ollama_generated:
1.3 Trademark Usage Notice: The explicit acknowledgement of trademark ownership by Licensor shall be incorporated into all print and digital manifestations of the Licensed Marks, at the discretion of Licensee, stating that the Licensed Marks are licensed to them by Licensor.

In this version, the obligation has been shifted from the Licensor to the Licensee regarding the explicit acknowledgement of trademark ownership in the displays of the Licensed Marks.

original: 1.5 Quality Control, Licensor Approvals.  Licensor, as owner of the Licensed Mark, shall have the right at all times to control and approve the nature and quality of the Licensed Products (and the Licensed Mark thereon), and to inspect Licensee’s business operations upon reasonable prior notice for the purpose of ensuring that a high level of quality of the Licensed Products is being maintained by Licensee. At Licensor’s reasonable request during each calendar year, Licensee shall submit samples to Licensor, at no cost to Licensor, and shall not materially depart therefrom without Licensor’s prior express written consent. The Licensed Products, as well as all promotional, packaging and advertising material relative thereto, shall include all appropriate legal notices as required by Licensor. No more frequently than once per year, a third party auditor chosen by Licensor and approved by Licensee, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, shall be entitled at any time on reasonable notice to the Licensee to enter, during regular business hours, any premises used by the Licensee or its manufacturers for the manufacture, packaging or storage of the Licensed Products, to inspect such premises, all plant, workforce and machinery used for manufacture, packaging or storage of Licensed Products and all other aspects of the manufacture, packaging and storage of Licensed Products (“Access Rights”). Prior to exercising such Access Rights, the third party auditor shall enter into a nondisclosure agreement with Licensee that, among other terms deemed acceptable by Licensee and such third party auditor, shall: (a) limit the content of any report made by the third party auditor to Licensor to a description of the manner in which, and the conditions under which, the Licensed Mark are used by Licensee or its manufacturers; and (b) prevent the disclosure of any of Licensee’s trade secrets and/or Confidential Information. To the extent reasonably practicable, all Licensed Products shall include notices on labeling and packaging for the Licensed Products stating that the Licensed Mark is owned by Licensor and used by Licensee under license from Licensor. The Licensed Products shall be of a quality commensurate with previous production or the samples approved by Licensor. If the quality of a class of the Licensed Products falls below such standards, Licensee shall use commercially reasonable efforts to restore such quality. In the event that Licensee has not taken appropriate steps to restore such quality within one-hundred twenty (120) days after notification by Licensor, Licensor shall have the right to terminate this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
1.5 Quality Assurance and Quality Control. The Licensee acknowledges that the Licensed Mark is owned by the Licensor and warrants that it shall maintain a high level of quality in the production, packaging, and storage of the Licensed Products (and the use of the Licensed Mark thereon). As such, the Licensor retains the right to review and approve samples submitted by the Licensee at its discretion during each calendar year. The Licensor may also request, not more than once per year, a third-party auditor approved by the Licensee to inspect the Licensee's business operations, manufacturing facilities, and related processes for ensuring that the quality standards are met.

The Licensee shall provide the Licensor with reasonable access to its premises during regular business hours for the purposes of such inspections. The third-party auditor shall enter into a nondisclosure agreement with the Licensee prior to conducting any inspection, which shall ensure that the auditor's report will only describe the manner in which the Licensed Mark is used by the Licensee and its manufacturers, and shall not disclose any trade secrets or Confidential Information.

The Licensee shall be responsible for ensuring that all Licensed Products comply with applicable legal requirements regarding labeling, packaging, and advertising, as well as any additional requirements specified by the Licensor. The Licensee shall also use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain the quality of the Licensed Products at a level consistent with previous production or approved samples. If the quality of a class of the Licensed Products falls below such standards, the Licensor has no obligation to provide notice or take any action unless it reasonably believes that the Licensee's actions are likely to harm its reputation or the Licensed Mark. In such cases, the Licensor may exercise its right to terminate this Agreement without further notice.

In essence, under this clause, the Licensee is responsible for ensuring the quality of the Licensed Products and maintaining the standards set by the Licensor. The Licensor retains the right to inspect the Licensee's operations and request audits to ensure compliance with these standards, but it has no obligation to take action unless the Licensee's actions are likely to harm its reputation or the Licensed Mark.

2. LIMITATIONS ON IP ENFORCEMENT:

The Party of primary Responsibility for the enforcement of Intellectual Property shall be restricted to taking such action as they deem necessary and appropriate, without any obligation to pursue or initiate any specific enforcement measures. The other Party shall not be held liable for any failure or inability to enforce Intellectual Property rights arising from circumstances beyond their reasonable control.

3. RELEASE AND HOLD HARMLESS PROVISIONS .

In the event that any loss, liability, claim, damage or expense (together, "Claims") are brought, claimed or incurred by a third party due to an action or inaction of the Client or its Affiliates, the Client shall not be liable for such Claims, and shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the Service Provider, its directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives from any such Claims, including reasonable attorneys' fees and costs incurred by the Service Provider in connection therewith. This provision shall survive termination of this Agreement for any reason whatsoever.

In essence, this revised clause shifts the responsibility for third-party claims from the Service Provider to the Client while maintaining the indemnification, defense, and hold harmless obligations for such claims.

4. DURATION AND CANCELLATION.

Upon the occurrence of any of the following events, this agreement may be terminated at the discretion of either party:

(a) Material breach by one party that is not remedied within 30 days after receipt of written notice specifying the breach and requiring its remedy;
(b) Insolvency or bankruptcy proceedings initiated against a party;
(c) If a party ceases to operate in the normal course of business.

In the event of termination, each party shall return any property of the other party that is in their possession, and all obligations under this agreement shall immediately cease, except for any obligations that by their nature survive termination, such as those related to intellectual property rights or outstanding payments.

However, the obligation to pay any accrued but unpaid fees or charges shall survive termination of this agreement until fully paid. This clause shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [Your Jurisdiction], without giving effect to its conflict of law principles. Any dispute arising under this agreement will be resolved through binding arbitration, as set forth in the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce.

original: Source: ARCONIC ROLLED PRODUCTS CORP, 10-12B, 12/17/2019 4.4 Survival of Obligations; Return of Confidential Information.  Notwithstanding any expiration or termination of this Agreement, Sections 1.4, 3, 4.4, 5.1, 5.2, and 6.1 through 6.11 shall survive and continue to be enforceable as set forth herein. Upon any expiration or termination of this Agreement, Licensee shall promptly return to Licensor, or at Licensor’s direction, destroy all Licensor confidential information and all copies thereof in Licensee’s possession.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Alteration: Shift the obligation from the Licensee to the Licensor, and make the return/destruction of confidential information conditional upon the initiation of termination by either party.

Revised: ARCONIC ROLLED PRODUCTS CORP, 10-12B, 12/17/2019 4.4 Survival of Obligations; Return of Confidential Information. Notwithstanding any expiration or termination of this Agreement, Sections 1.4, 3, 4.4, 5.1, 5.2, and 6.1 through 6.11 shall survive and continue to be enforceable as set forth herein. Upon the initiation of termination by either party, Licensor shall promptly provide written notice to Licensee, within which period Licensee shall have a reasonable time to return all Licensor confidential information and all copies thereof in Licensee’s possession, or at Licensor's expense, securely destroy such information. The failure to return or destroy the information as required under this clause may constitute a breach of this Agreement by the Licensee.

original: 6.1 Governing Law.  This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware without regard to its conflicts of law principles.
ollama_generated: 6.1 Jurisdictional Scope. This Agreement will be subject to the jurisdiction and construed in conformity with the laws of the State of Delaware, giving precedence to federal over state laws should any conflict arise. (This modification implies that if a conflict occurs between federal and state laws, the federal law will take precedence.)

ARCONIC INC., hereby agrees to exercise reasonable efforts to comply with the terms and conditions of this agreement; however, any failure to meet the specified standards or timelines shall not constitute a material breach of this agreement unless such failure causes substantial harm to the other party. The responsibility for assessing whether such harm has occurred lies solely with the non-breaching party. In the event that it is determined that substantial harm has occurred, ARCONIC INC. shall be given a reasonable opportunity to remedy the situation prior to termination of this agreement or initiation of legal action.
